name: Crossbowman

name: Caster

name: Caster Leader

name: Senior Caster

ability: Deals area damage to Operators on the four cardinal tiles next to the primary target.

name: Senior Caster Leader
description: One of Reunion's elite Casters, more dangerous than a normal Caster Leader. They use complex Area-of-Effect Arts, making them more potent than normal Casters. Proceed with caution.
ability: Deals area damage to Operators on the four cardinal tiles next to the primary target.

name: Airborne Soldier

name: Airborne Soldier Leader

name: Mortar Gunner Leader

name: Big Bob
description: One of Reunion's squad leaders. He wears a heavy blast suit and attacks with an electric chainsaw. He has been spotted leading peripheral operations in some remote areas, and is known to be a seasoned combatant and commander. Due to his devastating attacks and extreme survivability, proceed with utmost caution.

name: Big Adam
description: One of Reunion's squad leaders. He wears a heavy blast suit and attacks with an electric chainsaw. Bears a remarkable similarity to Big Bob, but does not appear to be the same person. It is unknown whether there is any relationship between the two of them. Data suggests that he may be even more dangerous than Big Bob. Due to his devastating attacks and extreme survivability, proceed with utmost caution.

name: Metal Crab

Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by enemy casters for use as cannon fodder during invasions.

name: Lurker

ability: Invisible

name: Wraith

ability: Cannot be blocked.

name: Monster

name: Monster Mk II

Equipped with a small gun and a long-range Arts receiver, they are likely operated by concealed Casters. Though unlikely to cause heavy damage to armored Operators, they can still pose a considerable threat.
ability: Flying unit.

name: Raptor

ability: Flying unit.

name: Defender-4

ability: Flying unit; increases the DEF of nearby enemy units.

name: Invisible Crossbowman

name: Arts Guard Leader

Their nickname is a bit more human-sounding than 'Log Splitter,' but humans are more terrifying than any machine.

name: Senior Armed Militant

Proceed with caution.

ability: Only attacks ground units. Melee attacks deal more damage. After a number of attacks, the next attack will release Corruption.

name: Londinium Mobile Defense Artillery
description: Part of Londinium's city defenses. Has a large attack area. Built by the city's workers in their factories.
ability: Long range. Locks on to the target with the highest max HP and bombards it several times, dealing Arts Damage to the unit in range with the highest HP percentage.

name: Londinium Precision Mobile Defense Artillery
description: Part of Londinium's city defenses. Has a very large attack area and greatly improved accuracy. Built by the city's workers in their factories.
ability: Long range. Locks on to the target with the highest max HP and bombards it several times, dealing Arts Damage to the unit in range with the highest HP percentage.

name: Steam Tank
description: Armored vehicle employing Victorian steam technology, even more dangerous when it has taken damage.
ability: When HP drops to 50%, ASPD and Movement Speed are greatly increased, and becomes immune to most control effects.

name: Scorching Steam Tank
description: Advanced armored vehicle employing Victorian steam technology, even more dangerous when it has taken damage. Virtually unstoppable when it is on a rampage.
ability: When HP drops to 50%, ASPD and Movement Speed are greatly increased, and becomes immune to most control effects.

name: Sarkaz Royal Court Caster
description: A caster of the Sarkaz Royal Court. Sarkaz witchcraft is often more dangerous in battle than war machines. They boast a distinctly Sarkaz fighting style, but with greater discipline.
ability: Attacks deal additional Necrosis Damage. Locks on to your units, dealing continuous Arts Damage, and causes area Necrosis damage when casting is complete.

name: Sarkaz Royal Court Elite Caster
description: An elite caster of the Sarkaz Royal Court. Sarkaz witchcraft is often more dangerous in battle than war machines. Their skill and discipline are second to none.
ability: Attacks deal additional Necrosis Damage. Locks on to your units, dealing continuous Arts Damage, and causes area Necrosis damage when casting is complete.

name: Theresis
description: Regent Theresis of Kazdel has gathered the Sarkaz army at Londinium and occupied The Shard. If total war is to be avoided, he must be stopped from declaring war on the dukes.
ability: Cannot attack. Does not deplete Life Points when it disappears. Knocks down anything in its way.

name: Famiglia Soldier
description: Low-level mafiosi who obey the orders of their superiors unquestioningly. Their lives are hardly worth anything, but their deaths are sufficient cause for their famiglia to seek revenge.
ability: Increases 'Blood Debt' by a miniscule amount when defeated.

name: Elite Famiglia Soldier
description: Battle-hardened, low-level mafiosi who are strong and swift-footed, worthy of being called elite fighters. When they are buried, the famiglia might send a letter of condolence home, nothing more.
ability: Increases 'Blood Debt' by a small amount when defeated.

name: Famiglia Crossbowman
description: Famiglia-trained crossbowmen, capable of striking from a distance. Crossbows for famiglia use are extremely sophisticated; when given emergency orders, these snipers will use basic Arts to complete their missions, not knowing where that knowledge came from.
ability: While under the 'Asset Liquidation' status, attacks are converted into Arts damage.

name: Elite Famiglia Crossbowman
description: Famiglia-trained crossbowmen with a wealth of experience. Their shots are more accurate, and more deadly as well. Famiglie always respect the ironclad order, so these crossbows are never upgraded into better models, and Arts remain just as essential as ever.
ability: While under the 'Asset Liquidation' status, attacks are converted into Arts damage.

name: Famiglia Intimidator
description: Famiglia-trained strongmen, their imposing statures a bluff of sorts. In actuality, famiglie value their mastery of Siracusan language over raw violence.
ability: Draws enemy fire; Increases 'Blood Debt' when defeated.

name: Famiglia Terrorizer
description: An exceptionally herculean famiglia strongman, known for his fiery temper. He does not begrudge the visits he pays to the relatives of others, but during key moments, his word is more resolute than stone.
ability: Draws enemy fire; Increases 'Blood Debt' when defeated.

name: Famiglia Caster
description: For Famiglia-trained Casters, their Originium Arts are the basis of their standing within the famiglia. Though these Casters have fairly mediocre Arts, they at least are effective at inciting hatred.
ability: Attacks two targets at once. Can stop attacking to continually increase 'Blood Debt'.

name: Elite Famiglia Caster
description: A skilled Caster can often turn the tide of a battle. Though these claim to hold formidable positions, everyone knows they are nothing without the protection of their famiglia.
ability: Attacks two targets at once. Can stop attacking to continually increase 'Blood Debt'.

name: Famiglia Limo
description: The famiglie's most common mode of transportation, sporting an interior as unassuming as the exterior, with only the bumper reinforced. In addition to transportation, they will also use this vehicle to bid 'buon viaggio' to their famiglia's enemies.
ability: Unloads 3 Famiglia Soldiers if this unit is defeated while blocked.

name: Famiglia Luxury Limo
description: A lesser-seen vehicle among the famiglie, sporting an unassuming exterior but a luxurious interior. Generally, these are only used to welcome the most distinguished of the famiglia's guests, and to convey to them the graces of the famiglia's high-ranking members.
ability: Unloads 3 Elite Famiglia Soldiers if this unit is defeated while blocked.

name: Famiglia Capo
description: A famiglia capo, highly respected and holding great power. Rumor has it that he never sets down his weapon, and though nobody knows where it might be hidden, some speculate that it may be inside his cigar.
ability: Increases 'Blood Debt' whenever an enemy unit is defeated within range.

name: Famiglia Heavy Capo
description: A ruthless famiglia capo who has commanded the awe of a great many mafiosi. He was there when the famiglie first rose to greatness, and withstood the tumultuous years of change up until the present. It seems that nothing can topple him now.
ability: Increases 'Blood Debt' whenever an enemy unit is defeated within range.

name: Famiglia Cleaner
description: A powerful assassin loyal to his famiglia, striking from the shadows before vanishing again, leaving only death in his wake. His title is known by all, but none dare speak of him.
ability: Gains additional buffs while under the 'Asset Liquidation' status. Invisible.

name: Famiglia Silent Cleaner
description: A peerless assassin loyal to his famiglia. The shadows serve his will, and he knows murder better than the back of his hand. He can be found in the background of every secret that has allowed his famiglia to rise and flourish, and those who have seen his true face are already buried six feet under.
ability: Gains additional buffs while under the 'Asset Liquidation' status. Invisible.

name: Father Agenir
description: Agenir, Sankta priest, one of the founders of Siracusa's ironclad order. Do not hesitate—though he does not necessarily stand opposed to you, his guns speak first. By the way, his favorite eye mask was made in Lungmen.
ability: Gradually increases 'Blood Debt'; Under the 'Asset Liquidation' status, attacks have global range. Attacks made using Ammo decrease the target's DEF, Max Ammo: 10.

name: 'None of My Business'
description: A drunken man wobbling around with his hat pulled low. The incendiary bombs lying around the battlefield have nothing to do with him. At least, that's what he's always insisted in his affidavits.
ability: After losing a certain percentage of HP, releases a permanent incendiary field. Friendly Operators inside the field take True damage every second.

name: Siracusan Civilian
description: These Siracusan civilians seem to have strayed into the fighting despite having been evacuated along with the rest of the crowd earlier. For whatever reason, whenever an accident of any sort happens, everyone's wrath falls upon you.
ability: Does not deplete Life Points when entering the Protection Objective; gradually reduces 'Blood Debt' over time while on the battlefield; however, increases 'Blood Debt' by a significant amount upon being defeated.

name: Special Forces Soldier
description: A mercenary under the long-term employ of a Victorian aristocrat. Often uses the terrain to conceal their movements.
ability: Gains Invisibility while in Reeds

name: Special Forces Captain
description: An experienced mercenary captain under the long-term employ of a Victorian aristocrat. Often uses the terrain to hide their movements.
ability: Gains Invisibility while in Reeds

name: Swamp Gloompincer
description: An Infected Creature commonly found in the swamps of Southern Victoria, known for randomly attacking travelers in the wilderness and posing a threat to the locals.
ability: Immune to the effects of Mire; gains increased Movement Speed while in Mire

name: Enraged Swamp Gloompincer
description: An Infected Creature commonly found in the swamps of Southern Victoria, more active than the regular gloompincers, known for attacking travelers in the wilderness and posing a huge threat to the locals.
ability: Immune to the effects of Mire; gains increased Movement Speed while in Mire

name: Dublinn Flamechaser Soldier
description: A Dublinn soldier fused with their Leader's ember. Long since dead, but Arts manipulation keeps their bodies moving towards their final desire, rising again and again.
ability: Attacks deal additional Burn damage while near burning Reeds; when defeated, turns into an Invisible Ember of Resentment that must be damaged 5 times to defeat, respawns after a period of time

name: Dublinn Flamechaser Elite Soldier
description: A elite Dublinn soldier fused with their Leader's ember. Chasing their Leader's ember even more fervently, their bodies are manipulated by Arts to ceaselessly rise from the dead.
ability: Attacks deal additional Burn damage while near burning Reeds; when defeated, turns into an Invisible Ember of Fury that must be damaged 5 times to defeat, respawns after a period of time

name: Dublinn Cannoneer
description: A ranged combatant in the Dublinn forces. They use a modified standard-issue Victorian military crossbow fitted with a launcher for explosive ammunition.
ability: After two attacks, the next attack deals Splash damage

name: Dublinn Cannoneer Captain
description: Captain of a ranged squad in the Dublinn forces. They use a modified standard-issue Victorian military crossbow fitted with a launcher for even more powerful explosive ammunition.
ability: After two attacks, the next attack deals Splash damage

name: Dublinn Flamecaller
description: A caster in the Dublinn forces skilled at manipulating flame, ignites everything around them, even their own deaths.
ability: Attacks ignite Reeds beneath the target; when defeated, deals Arts damage to all nearby friendly units and ignites Reeds

name: Dublinn Flamecaller Captain
description: An elite caster in the Dublinn forces extremely adept at manipulating flame, ignites everything around them, even their own deaths.
ability: Attacks ignite Reeds beneath the target; when defeated, deals Arts damage to all nearby friendly units and ignites Reeds

name: Swamp Rover
description: A military vehicle capable of traveling smoothly through swampy terrain, fitted with advanced detection equipment.
ability: Immune to the effects of Mire, nullifies the Camouflage and Invisibility effects of nearby friendly units

name: Heavy Swamp Rover
description: A military vehicle capable of traveling smoothly through swampy terrain, fitted with advanced detection equipment and reinforced armor.
ability: Immune to the effects of Mire, nullifies the Camouflage and Invisibility effects of nearby friendly units

name: Dublinn Flamechaser Guard
description: A Dublinn defender fused with their Leader's ember. Long since dead, but the Arts embedded in their equipment keep them standing to fight for their ambitions.
ability: Attacks deal additional Burn damage while near burning Reeds and takes reduced Physical and Arts damage; when defeated, turns into an Invisible Ember of Avarice that must be damaged 10 times to defeat, respawns after a period of time

name: Dublinn Flamechaser Elite Guard
description: A elite Dublinn defender fused with their Leader's ember. Chasing their Leader's ember even more fervently, the Arts embedded in their equipment make them hard to defeat.
ability: Attacks deal additional Burn damage while near burning Reeds and takes reduced Physical and Arts damage; when defeated, turns into an Invisible Ember of Arrogance that must be damaged 10 times to defeat, respawns after a period of time

name: Dublinn Spec Ops
description: A soldier under the command of 'The Brigadier.' Specializing in ambushes and assaults, they are well-disciplined and completely devoted to the cause.
ability: Ignites Reeds upon passing by them; after 3 attacks, unleashes 5 consecutive slashes at the target

name: Dublinn Elite Spec Ops
description: An elite soldier under the command of 'The Brigadier.' The core of their ambush and assault tactics, they are well-disciplined and completely devoted to the cause.
ability: Ignites Reeds upon passing by them; after 3 attacks, unleashes 5 consecutive slashes at the target

name: 'The Brigadier'
description: 'The Brigadier,' a senior Dublinn officer and captain of the Redsteel Guard. With a blade tempered by the flames of war, he cuts through the chaos to find the order he has set his mind on.
ability: Ignites Reeds upon passing by them; after 3 attacks, unleashes 5 powerful consecutive slashes at the target

name: Di Beast
description: One of Ya's off-handed creations. With a body the color of the golden sands and extremely keen hearing, it stalks the streets like a shadow, collecting and relaying information.

name: Raging Di Beast
description: One of Ya's off-handed creations, its bloodlust honed by the golden sands. It is extremely keen of hearing and stalks the streets like a shadow, both fighting and collecting and relaying information.

name: Shanhaizhong Skirmisher
description: An ordinary Shanhaizhong member with a complex past. Their ridiculous slogan of 'the mounts, seas, and all in between shall be our master's' has spurred a large group of bandits to make trouble all over Yan.
ability: Gains increased Attack Range when on Yumen Catastrophe Defenses

name: Shanhaizhong Vigilante
description: An ordinary Shanhaizhong member with a complex past. Their ridiculous slogan of 'the mounts, seas, and all in between shall be our master's' has spurred a large group of bandits to make trouble all over Yan, and many of them are involved in lawsuits.
ability: Gains increased Attack Range when on Yumen Catastrophe Defenses

name: Shanhaizhong Relayer
description: A Shanhaizhong member responsible for relaying tactical orders. With their use of ciphers, they're more like trained professionals than a disorganized band of rogues.
ability: Deploys a Shanhaizhong Cipher Machine on the first deployable Yumen Catastrophe Defenses

name: Shanhaizhong Harbinger
description: A Shanhaizhong member responsible for analyzing intel and relaying tactical orders. With their use of ciphers, they're more like trained professionals than a disorganized band of rogues.
ability: Deploys a Shanhaizhong Cipher Machine on the first deployable Yumen Catastrophe Defenses

name: Shanhaizhong Desperado
description: A Shanhaizhong member tasked with defense. The Shanhaizhong have recruited many desperadoes, using their burly physiques and heavy shields to provide shelter for their comrades.

name: Shanhaizhong Phalanx
description: A Shanhaizhong member tasked with defense. The Shanhaizhong have recruited many desperadoes, many of them were the disasters of their places. With their burly physiques and special heavy shields, they are a threatening line of defense.

name: Shanhaizhong Ringleader
description: A Shanhaizhong leader hidden in their ranks. Elusive and unflinchingly cruel, are these acts of 'faith' delusional or simply selfish?
ability: Has Invisibility; the next attack made after breaking invisibility will inflict increased damage

name: Shanhaizhong Secret-Keeper
description: A Shanhaizhong leader with a mysterious mission. Elusive, merciless, and unconcerned with their men's sacrifices. What are they really planning behind that fog of faith?
ability: Has Invisibility; the next attack made after breaking invisibility will inflict increased damage

name: Shanhaizhong Seer
description: Shanhaizhong members who can cast strange Arts. They superstitiously believe in those huge beings, shouting 'the mounts, seas, and all in between shall be our master's' while displaying a fraction of that 'divine power.'
ability: Attacks inflict Arts damage; continuously locks on to a target and inflicts a large burst of Arts damage after the channel completes, gaining increased ASPD afterwards

name: Shanhaizhong Oracle
description: Shanhaizhong members who can cast strange Arts. They superstitiously believe in those huge beings and resent their own compatriots, shouting 'the mounts, seas, and all in between shall be our master's' while displaying a 'divine power' of unknown origin.
ability: Attacks inflict Arts damage; continuously locks on to a target and inflicts a large burst of Arts damage after the channel completes, gaining increased ASPD afterwards

name: 'Wallbreaker'
description: A siege cannon engineered by the Ministry of Engineering, hijacked by the Shanhaizhong when they infiltrated Yumen. Yumen rampages over the sea of sand, advancing unhindered, shattering stone and resolve alike.
ability: Prioritizes attacking friendly units located on Yumen Catastrophe Defenses

name: 'Fortbreaker'
description: A stronger siege cannon engineered by the Ministry of Engineering, hijacked by the Shanhaizhong when they infiltrated Yumen. Yumen rampages over the sea of sand, advancing unhindered, threatening to tear down all walls.
ability: Prioritizes attacking friendly units located on Yumen Catastrophe Defenses

name: 'Sandwalker'
description: A transport vehicle engineered by the Ministry of Engineering, hijacked by the Shanhaizhong when they infiltrated Yumen. Can carry up to four soldiers smoothly over desert terrain.
ability: Can only be blocked by units with at least 4 Block; when next to enemies that are both non-Machine and non-Leader, they will be loaded inside as passengers (up to 4 max), and will be unloaded when this unit reaches a Ladder

name: 'Sand Voyager'
description: A 2nd generation transport vehicle engineered by the Ministry of Engineering, hijacked by the Shanhaizhong when they infiltrated Yumen. Can carry up to four soldiers over desert terrain or coordinate in urban defense.
ability: Can only be blocked by units with at least 4 Block; when next to enemies that are both non-Machine and non-Leader, they will be loaded inside as passengers (up to 4 max), and will be unloaded when this unit reaches a Ladder

name: Hornbeast
description: An herbivore that moves in herds, common to the mountains. Docile creatures, they hide from predators using the mock-vegetation wool on their backs, but that's no reason to underestimate their pointed horns.
ability: Starts battle Resting. After being attacked, it and all surrounding hornbeasts become Combat-Ready.

name: Hardy Hornbeast
description: A variety of hornbeast which startles into a frenzy at the drop of a hat. They attack viciously, throwing their sharp horns against anything nearby without the slightest warning. Given how often they concuss themselves, scholars are extremely confused as to how they haven't gone extinct yet.
ability: Starts battle Resting. After being attacked, it and all surrounding hornbeasts become Combat-Ready.

name: Oxmane
description: A carnivore common to the mountains that hunts primarily in packs. Bearing developed mandibles, they crush their prey's skulls with ease. Most fond of feeding on hornbeast stragglers.
ability: Prioritizes attacking hornbeasts.

name: Keenfanged Oxmane
description: An Oxmane subspecies particular to certain regions. Perennial contention with large prey has led their teeth to grow sharp, sinking fast and firm into the fleshy parts of their quarry. Undeterred by their companions dying to their prey's retaliation, they will launch attacks again and again.
ability: Prioritizes attacking hornbeasts.

name: Blazing Originium Slug
description: A wild infected creature, they spray superheated fluids at their foes, posing more of a threat than typical Originium Slugs. Abundant in environments with abnormal energy, their breeding and migration patterns remain a mystery.
ability: Attacks deal Arts damage and Burn Damage.

name: Pyric Originium Slug
description: A wild infected creature, the final stages of infection having led them to burn even hotter. Their fluids, hot as magma, melt even their own bodies. Once cooled, beautiful patterns can be found in the pools they leave behind.
ability: Attacks deal Arts damage and Burn Damage.

name: Chitotex Clawbeast
description: An herbivore that dwells by cliffsides, their front claws equipped for digging out rock faces. They grow rear shells hard enough to withstand falling stones, but bear unusually soft bellies. Their delicious meat is the primary cause of their falling population.
ability: Weak spot located on its front, damage dealt to the rear significantly decreased.

name: Keratex Clawbeast
description: A Chitotex Clawbeast subspecies particular to certain regions. Their sturdy upper limbs accelerate their excavation of rock exponentially, while their stern shells can shrug off severe batterings. These traits allow them to better expand their territory.
ability: Weak spot located on its front, damage dealt to the rear significantly decreased.

name: Basorobeast
description: An herbivore that dwells by cliffsides. The protective boulders that crown their heads are, in fact, the secretions of a symbiotic organism. Some have witnessed Basorobeasts battling Chitotex Clawbeasts in turf wars.
ability: Weak spot located on its rear, damage dealt to the front significantly decreased.

name: Gravorobeast
description: A Basorobeast subspecies particular to certain regions. Regimens of knocking into cliff rock since infancy have honed their heads to exceptional sturdiness, able to shrug off fierce frontal attacks. Survival never ends, and the struggle never ceases.
ability: Weak spot located on its rear, damage dealt to the front significantly decreased.

name: Serrant Fowlbeast
description: A large and violent fowlbeast, it shoots sharp pennaceous feathers from the air to drive prey out of hiding, then uses strong claws to finish targets off once they're on their last legs. Liable to use prey clutched in its claws as an additional weapon against intruders in its territory.
ability: Occasionally flings dead Oxmanes, dealing Physical Damage.

name: Daimoserrant Fowlbeast
description: A Serrant Fowlbeast subspecies particular to certain regions. Stronger pectoral muscles increase its flight capabilities, rendering it capable of launching torrential offensives from high elevation. It makes a renewed territorial bid, this time on the entire sky.
ability: Occasionally flings dead Oxmanes, dealing Physical Damage.

name: Direswine
description: A robustly built omnivore, with an impenetrable epidermis leaving them with few natural predators. Violent headbutts are both their method of attack and a habit necessary for suppressing the growth of their fangs.
ability: Takes up 2 Block slots; Gradually accelerates when charging, dealing damage based on Movement Speed to any target it passes through or is blocked by.

name: Raging Direswine
description: A variety of Direswine extremely easy to anger, they dominate areas near water sources with great swagger. If one is enraged, it will indiscriminately rampage about with a madness sufficient to lay anything in the vicinity low.
ability: Takes up 2 Block slots; Gradually accelerates when charging, dealing damage based on Movement Speed to any target it passes through or is blocked by.

name: Haribeast
description: A dangerous creature with a back covered in thorns. Every thorn has a developed and impressively elastic muscular connection; upon sensing danger, they can fire their thorns with an abrupt and startling power. Even so, some people still aspire to raise them as pets.
ability: Weak spot located on its front, damage dealt to the rear significantly decreased; deals damage in a semicircle to the rear at every fixed portion of health lost.

name: Rainer Haribeast
description: A variety of haribeast growing unusual thorns, which can be shot at speeds rivaling that of arrows. Minute barbs grow on the tips, leaving wounds that fail to heal long after the skin is broken. Once, someone announced they'd successfully tamed one of these creatures; afterwards, they were never seen again.
ability: Weak spot located on its front, damage dealt to the rear significantly decreased; deals damage in a semicircle to the rear at every fixed portion of health lost.

name: Cautelotaur
description: A predator crafty by nature, with sightings of this species rarely reported. After feeding on the Chitotex Clawbeast, it uses the leftover carapace as a defensive tool, blocking fatal attacks in fights.
ability: After feeding on a Chitotex Clawbeast, leaves its shell to use as a defensive tool, significantly lowering all damage except to the rear.

name: Kouaku Cautelotaur
description: A cunning and ruthless variety of Cautelotaur, it conceals itself in herds to launch surprise attacks, the prey it catches subjected to its capricious whims. Most hunters that attempt to hunt this creature return with nothing to show for it.
ability: After feeding on a Chitotex Clawbeast, leaves its shell to use as a defensive tool, significantly lowering all damage except to the rear.

name: Norport Civilian
description: Ordinary folk scattered throughout Norport Borough. Abandoned by Londinium and subjected to the Sarkaz's high-handed blockade, these orphans have become the ones most deeply affected by the haze of war.
ability: Friendly Unit. Once their identity is confirmed, raises your cost limit after retreating to the Protection Objective

name: Norport Spy
description: Military spies disguised as civilians in Norport Borough, lacking the communication channels to pass on their abundant intel. They were already helping their Dukes learn about their rivals before the borough broke off from Londinium, and have seamlessly transitioned to spying on the Sarkaz Army's movements after the Military Commission seized control.
ability: Friendly Unit. Once their identity is confirmed, raises your cost limit after retreating to the Protection Objective

name: Pathfinder Spy
description: A spy hired by a mysterious employer to monitor their rivals while disguised as civilians. Most are amateurs at gathering intelligence, and their impulsiveness and unorthodox practices often expose the secrets they think they're keeping safe.
ability: Spy. When their identity is revealed, the next attack's ATK is greatly increased

name: Pathfinder Spymaster
description: A spy hired by a mysterious employer to monitor their rivals while disguised as civilians. These seasoned operatives will occasionally employ less orthodox methods to get their more impatient rivals to let down their guard.
ability: Spy. When their identity is revealed, the next attack's ATK is greatly increased

name: Sentry Spy
description: A spy hired by a mysterious employer to monitor their rivals while disguised as civilians. They have obviously undergone professional intelligence training, and the complexity of the blockade taught them even more about carefully observing their environment.
ability: Spy. When their identity is revealed, becomes invisible

name: Sentry Spymaster
description: A spy hired by a mysterious employer to monitor their rivals while disguised as civilians. They know the blockade inside-out, and prefer to first gather enough crucial information before proceeding to the next step of their plans.
ability: Spy. When their identity is revealed, becomes invisible

name: Armed Spy
description: A spy hired by a mysterious employer to sabotage their rivals while disguised as civilians. They are more or less professional soldiers with training in gathering intelligence, and their reliable weaponry and ample combat experience make them even more of a threat.

name: Armed Spymaster
description: A spy hired by a mysterious employer to sabotage their rivals while disguised as civilians. They use their sharp intuition to judge the appropriate time to join the fray, and are able to resolutely execute their well-prepared plans.

name: Sarkaz Absurdist Operative
description: Operatives attached to the Military Commission, specializing in gathering intelligence and softening the enemy frontlines. The actual leaders of this unit are a mystery, and are surprisingly always the first to show up wherever the Military Commission is operating.
ability: Attacks reduce cost when carrying ammo. Max ammo: 3

name: Sarkaz Absurdist Operative Leader
description: Operatives attached to the Military Commission, primarily tasked with assassinating high-value targets. When on a mission, they often arrive before their subordinates to soften the enemy frontlines with incredible speed, while simultaneously planning their next action.
ability: Attacks reduce cost when carrying ammo. Max ammo: 3

name: Sarkaz Absurdist Splitcaster Apprentice
description: A product of the cooperation between the Damazti Cluster and the Military Commission. Under the guidance of the Damazti Cluster, these extraordinarily gifted Sarkaz have learned to split themselves in two with Arts. However, every split places a heavy burden on the caster's body, and each imperfect replica merely makes them an easier target on the battlefield.
ability: When HP is below half, creates a clone at their location

name: Sarkaz Absurdist Splitcaster
description: A product of the cooperation between the Damazti Cluster and the Military Commission, able to effortlessly split themselves in two with Arts. They can easily adapt their imperfect replicas to draw the enemy's attention and give themselves an advantage.
ability: When HP is below half, creates a clone at their location

name: Sarkaz Absurdist Tyrant
description: A product of the cooperation between the Damazti Cluster and the Military Commission. Under the guidance of the Damazti Cluster, these Sarkaz soldiers have learned to use transformation Arts to appear more intimidating. However, the body affects the mind, and their lack of rationality makes them even more brutal in battle.
ability: Can only be blocked by units with at least 3 Block; first attack deals splash damage

name: Sarkaz Absurdist Tyrant Captain
description: A product of the cooperation between the Damazti Cluster and the Military Commission, able to change their appearance with Arts. They can skillfully manipulate their flesh without damaging their brains, and are used to employing their intimidating forms to gain an advantage in battle.
ability: Can only be blocked by units with at least 3 Block; first attack deals splash damage

name: Rebellion Instigator
description: Disruptors that constantly bypass the blockade. They weaken the enemy's forces from within by eagerly sowing fear among the masses, who in their panic break down the borough defenses all on their own.
ability: When not blocked, all unrevealed Civilians or Spies cannot be blocked

name: Rebellion Agitator
description: Disruptors that constantly bypass the blockade. They weaken the enemy's forces from within by taking the initiative to whip the masses into a frenzy, who in turn break down the borough defenses all on their own.
ability: When not blocked, all unrevealed Civilians or Spies cannot be blocked

name: Withering Collector Disciple
description: An organic construct containing the Nachzehrer King's Originium Arts. It can extract all kinds of dead souls from the battlefield to create Seeds of Withering.
ability: Periodically summons several Seeds of Withering

name: Decaying Collector Disciple
description: An organic construct containing the Nachzehrer King's Originium Arts. It can extract all kinds of dead souls from the battlefield to create Seeds of Decay.
ability: Periodically summons several Seeds of Decay

name: 'Trilby Asher'
description: 'Forever honor one's commitments,' the proud motto of House Caster. While the Duke's military and political might are more than enough to back their word, the 'Trilby Ashers' are the real reason why the Duke of Caster's words hold any weight.
ability: After several attacks, moves towards the next checkpoint for the next attack

name: 'Shadowing Trilby Asher'
description: To the Duke of Caster, a 'Trilby Asher' is more of a consumable than a collectible. On the day a 'Trilby Asher' is honored with the job, another 'Shadowing Trilby Asher' is also born—only succeeding their predecessor when their mentor dies.
ability: After several attacks, moves towards the next checkpoint for the next attack

name: Deconstructed Distortion
description: The Damazti Cluster has spent their long life trying to study themselves. This intelligent and audacious long-lived has tried to surmount the limitations of the flesh and bestow life to inanimate objects, but 'immortality' remains a difficult premise to prove.
ability: Attacks inflict Corrosion Damage; loses HP every second

name: Military Hound
description: Military hounds that first saw action in Bolívar. Their claws and fangs are as vicious as their temperament.

name: Elite Military Hound
description: Carefully picked military hounds that chase their quarry to the bitter end.

name: Trimounts City Defender
description: Columbian soldiers stationed in Trimounts. They have close ties to all the tech companies and first dibs on cutting-edge equipment.
ability: When attacking, temporarily reduces your Operators' Block by 1; if Operator is on a Gravity Switch, reduces their Block to 0

name: Trimounts City Defender Captain
description: Columbian soldiers stationed in Trimounts. They have a good understanding of all the tech companies and will choose to fight with their favorite corporation's equipment.
ability: When attacking, temporarily reduces your Operators' Block by 1; if Operator is on a Gravity Switch, reduces their Block to 0

name: Arc Commando
description: Soldiers from the experimental unit born of the 'Horizon Arc Project,' able to fly at low altitudes with their jet propulsion equipment.
ability: If Movement Speed is higher than starting speed, gains Low-Altitude Hovering and takes off!

name: Arc Commando Captain
description: Soldiers from the experimental unit born of the 'Horizon Arc Project,' skilled at flying with their jet propulsion equipment. They enjoy the feeling of defying gravity.
ability: If Movement Speed is higher than starting speed, gains Low-Altitude Hovering and takes off!

name: Arc Frontliner
description: Deadly soldiers from an experimental unit outfitted with cutting-edge equipment. However, the instability of their gear is their weak spot.
ability: Attacks deal Arts damage; loses HP proportional to distance moved when shifted

name: Arc Frontliner Leader
description: Deadly soldiers from an experimental unit outfitted with highly lethal cutting-edge equipment. A formidable foe even when their gear's weaknesses have been revealed.
ability: Attacks deal Arts damage; loses HP proportional to distance moved when shifted

name: Arc Screenguard
description: Soldiers from an experimental unit with formidable defenses using the most advanced alloy technologies. However, the unresolved instability of the material makes them better suited for short, high-pressure skirmishes than drawn-out battles.
ability: Starting DEF and RES are high, but reduced whenever damage is taken

name: Arc Screenguard Captain
description: Soldiers from an experimental unit with formidable defenses using the most advanced alloy technologies. They don't even need their equipment to hold the frontline and prevent the enemy's advance.
ability: Starting DEF and RES are high, but reduced whenever damage is taken

name: 'Offender' Production Model
description: Unmanned attack vehicles primarily developed by Volvort Kochinski. Equipped with advanced power units, they assault the enemy with their solid defenses and high speed.
ability: Takes up 3 Block; when passing by an Operator, deals physical damage to it based on Movement Speed

name: 'Offender' Prototype
description: Unmanned attack vehicles primarily developed by Volvort Kochinski. Equipped with advanced power units, they fiercely assault the enemy with their solid defenses and high speed.
ability: Takes up 3 Block; when passing by an Operator, deals physical damage to it based on Movement Speed

name: 'Crossroads' Production Model
description: Unmanned defense vehicles primarily developed by Volvort Kochinski. They emit mid-length lasers in all four directions, providing excellent defense in narrow corridors, and significantly hindering the enemy even in open terrain.
ability: Attacks in 4 directions while moving, dealing Arts Damage. Increased damage to nearby targets. Continuously tries to push nearby Planetary Debris

name: 'Crossroads' Prototype
description: Unmanned defense vehicles primarily developed by Volvort Kochinski. They emit intense mid-length lasers in all four directions, providing first-class defense in narrow corridors, and dramatically hindering the enemy even in open terrain.
ability: Attacks in 4 directions while moving, dealing Arts Damage. Increased damage to nearby targets. Continuously tries to push nearby Planetary Debris

name: 'Traffic Tower' Production Model
description: A robot primarily developed by Volvort Kochinski, the crystallization of cutting-edge advances in every field. Volvort Kochinski wanted to use this design to win back the DOD's favor, but it was overshadowed by the Galleria Stellaria.
ability: Takes up 4 Block; DEF and RES reduced when damage is taken; when destroyed, releases 'Traffic Officer' and self-destructs, dealing physical damage to nearby units

name: 'Traffic Tower' Prototype
description: A robot primarily developed by Volvort Kochinski, the crystallization of cutting-edge advances in every field. If they could lower the cost of production to make it feasible for mass-production, perhaps it could even change the nature of warfare.
ability: Takes up 4 Block; DEF and RES reduced when damage is taken; when destroyed, releases 'Traffic Officer Captain' and self-destructs, dealing physical damage to nearby units

name: 'Traffic Officer'
description: Pilot of a 'Traffic Tower,' the cream of the crop from the military's strict selection process. Has impressive combat abilities even after leaving their robot.
ability: Starts temporarily invisible and accelerates. When attacking, temporarily reduces your Operators' Block by -1; if Operator is on a Gravity Switch, reduces their Block to 0

name: 'Traffic Officer Captain'
description: Pilot of a 'Traffic Tower,' the cream of the crop from the military's strict selection process. Has formidable combat abilities even after leaving their robot. They are even trained to detonate their vehicle in emergencies and continue the fight on foot.
ability: Starts temporarily invisible and accelerates. When attacking, temporarily reduces your Operators' Block by -1; if Operator is on a Gravity Switch, reduces their Block to 0

name: Duck Lord
description: A famous Columbian investor, entrepreneur, and master of 'Duck Power.' Out of the public eye, enjoys kicking back with others...
ability: Does not deduct Life Points when spared; Cannot be Blocked; Has significantly increased Movement Speed after being attacked.

name: Gopnik
description: The Ursus security guard hired by Duck Lord. Powerful, but not very smart. Mainly responsible for carrying luggage for Duck Lord.
ability: Does not deduct Life Points when spared; Cannot be Stunned.

name: Crying Thief
description: A Perro who left his family to seek out a new life... but all that people know is that he is always weeping.
ability: Does not deplete Life Points when entering objective point. Invisible. Attacks stun the target.

name: Derisive Audience
description: A diehard fan of the Crimson Troupe, they enjoy the performances night and day. They have become as incomprehensible as the troupe itself.
ability: Attacks inflict additional Nervous Impairment

name: Scarlet Singer
description: A performer of the Crimson Troupe, they unleash their singing voices when sufficiently stimulated, inciting their followers to attack in a frenzy.
ability: Attacks inflict Nervous Impairment; After receiving a certain number of hits, greatly increases all enemies' ASPD for a short period.

name: Theater Golem
description: A gigantic golem maintained by the Crimson Troupe's prop department, they are normally used to move bulky items. They are massive and difficult to block.
ability: Can only be blocked by units with at least 4 Block; Attacks deal splash damage to allied units in a small area around self.

name: 'Small Surprise'
description: A special gift prepared by the Crimson Troupe for the audience. Every audience member who receives a gift will become particularly 'ecstatic'.
ability: Does not attack; Upon death, deals Arts damage to all surrounding units and inflicts Nervous Impairment.

name: Ominous Apparition
description: A patch of shadow. It has never once left, nor has it ever truly existed.
ability: Has a chance to dodge Physical and Arts attacks when not blocked; Uses skills to deal Physical damage to the surrounding area; Attacks and skills ignore a certain amount of armor and inflict Nervous Impairment.

name: Bone Sea Drifter
description: Sea Terrors travel in large swarms, seeking carcasses to feast on and becoming food for other Sea Terrors themselves.
ability: Attacks inflict additional Corrosion Damage.

name: Ocean Stonecutter
description: Sea Terror with a hard shell, protecting the swarm from enemies.
ability: When your units enter its attack range for the first time, temporarily stops moving and gains increased DEF.

name: Retching Broodmother
description: Sea Terror mothers that throw fake offspring at oncoming threats, allowing the true offspring to flee.
ability: Can only attack ground targets. Summons 1 [Baleful Broodling] near the target when dealing damage.

name: Baleful Broodling
description: An extension of the broodmother's body, identical to newly-born offspring.
ability: Cannot move; loses HP over time; attacks inflict additional Corrosion Damage.

name: Skimming Sea Drifter
description: Some Sea Terrors have begun to adapt to the sky, able to glide above the waves for extended periods. Perhaps this branch will eventually evolve to make their home in the heavens.
ability: [Low-Altitude Hovering], attacks inflict additional Corrosion Damage.

name: Pathshaper Fractal
description: Fractals left behind by the Seaborn Pathshaper. Illusions must eventually vanish. The path is not clear. Search on, search on.
ability: Dies after some time. Every 3rd attack summons a [Pathshaper Fractal].

name: Ishar'mla's Tears
description: Manifestation of Ishar'mla's explorative and combative nature.
ability: Appears around your units, periodically dealing True Damage. If there are no targets within attack range, charges up [Ishar'mla, Heart of Corruption]. Disappears when [Ishar'mla, Heart of Corruption] transforms.

name: Izumik's Offspring
description: One of Izumik's evolutionary branches, bringing genetic data collected across Terra back to the mother.
ability: Becomes a random enemy when blocked.

name: Chest Seaborn
description: Sea Terror disguised as a treasure chest, often used by Bishops of the Deep to protect hideouts.

name: Retrofitted Gastruck
description: A pesticide spraying vehicle that used to belong to a large nomadic city. It has been retrofitted by Closure to spray tear gas instead, but she didn't have time to install an IFF system.
ability: When unblocked, all allied units lose HP constantly

name: Supercharged Gastruck
description: A pesticide spraying vehicle that used to belong to a large nomadic city. It has been retrofitted by Closure to spray tear gas instead, but she didn't have time to install an IFF system. This model has an expanded gas tank and is far more dangerous.
ability: When unblocked, all allied units lose HP constantly

name: Cheap Second-hand Drone
description: Cheap goods sold for scrap from the Kazimierz arenas. Feel free to waste it however you like.
ability: When destroyed, grants a deployable unit; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

name: Remodeled Second-hand Drone
description: Cheap goods sold for scrap from the Kazimierz arenas. Closure has performed some slight modifications on this batch, but it won't change the fact these are cheap as hell.
ability: When destroyed, grants a deployable unit; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

name: Mobile Power Source
description: An experimental prototype developed during the early years of a certain Columbian tech company. The objective was to provide power on the battlefield, however due to the lack of a positioning device, it will often leave by itself if unattended to.
ability: Cannot be blocked; When destroyed, recovers the SP of nearby Operators; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

name: 'Pompeii'
description: A massive infected beast. These aberrations were born in a special high-temperature environment. Nobody wants to approach these creatures due to their grotesque appearance and the extreme heat they give off. The existence of these giant creatures has been known since ancient times, but to see one warped by infection is terrifyingly unforgettable...
ability: Attacks up to four targets simultaneously; Ignites targets it attacks, dealing burn damage over time; When blocked, self-immolates to cause high damage; Gains a large amount of ASPD when this unit's HP is under 50%.

name: Skullshatterer
description: One of Reunion's squad leaders who serves in the Assault Squad. Though armed with an Originium launcher and explosives, reports show that he possesses high mobility and poses a significant threat even in melee combat.He has been seen several times around Lungmen, and intel suggests that he is carrying out some special operation in the region.
ability: Launches grenades when not being blocked, reducing the DEF of the primary target and surrounding allied Operators significantly; Increases ATK significantly when HP is under 50%.

name: Crownslayer
description: One of Reunion's squad leaders who handles infiltration and assassination operations, specializing in melee combat and breaking through defensive lines. Her stealth and superb infiltration abilities have foiled countless attempts to capture her.
ability: Can pass through Operators if blocked.

name: Talulah
description: The leader and spokesperson of Reunion. So far, she has been confirmed to have masterminded multiple riots, as well as the destruction of Chernobog.
ability: Long-ranged attacks and [Stellar Corona] deal Arts damage; When blocked, uses melee attacks that deal True damage; Applies [Burning Breath] to one target (Deals increasing True damage each second, but can be resisted); When HP drops beneath half, gains greatly increased DEF and RES, and uses Skills more often.

name: W
description: A Sarkaz Mercenary and one of Reunion's squad leaders, she carries around a weapon that resembles a Laterano Gun. However, she almost exclusively attacks using explosives and throwing weapons. One of her common strategies is to attack the enemy's flank using large amounts of active Originium explosives. However, her erratic movements make her almost impossible to predict...
ability: Can use explosives to deal massive physical damage;

name: FrostNova
description: A Caster who is one of Reunion's squad leaders. She is one of the few Casters capable of suppressing enemies in a head-on engagement. Among the squads she leads, the special 'Yeti Squadron' assists her in some special operations. As her name implies, she has a cold personality.
ability: Frequently uses Arts to attack nearby Operators with an Ice Nova, dealing high Arts damage as well as slowing the AS of affected targets; Can also Freeze tiles indefinitely, making it impossible to deploy Operators on these tiles.

name: Mephisto
description: A Medic who is one of Reunion's squad leaders, often working in tandem with Faust. He heals the wounded while commanding his troops to attack, and can improve their life recovery rate. He boasts a high resistance to Arts. Currently, it has been confirmed that he is the one controlling the Hosts.
ability: Doubles the HP regeneration of all enemies on the field; Normal attack heals 3 enemy units at a time.

name: Faust
description: A Sniper who is one of Reunion's squad leaders, often working in tandem with Mephisto. He uses extremely long-range attacks to inflict devastating physical damage. He is known to occasionally use special attacks such as summoning turret-like ballistae or launching highly destructive bolts.
ability: Cannot be blocked and gains invulnerability for a period of time; May attack with a special bolt dealing double damage; Regularly activates hidden turrets around the battlefield.

name: 'Rat King'
description: Lin, Lin Gray, the Rat King of the slum. He bears many titles, just like the shifting of the city's shadows underneath his feet. Don't touch the red lines. If you ever have a moment of indecisiveness, whatever it is that you were concerned about will become nothing more than a whisper in the winds above the dunes.
ability: Greatly increased DEF when the shield is present; targets the unit with the highest Max HP with 'Singing Sands', inflicting massive Physical damage; targets the unit with the lowest Max HP with 'Sand Tomb', reducing the target's ATK and continuously inflicting Arts damage.

name: FrostNova, 'Winter's Scar'
description: Leader of the Yeti Squadron, she has released the remainder of what little life force she has left in preparation for the final battle. The biting cold of the land has already been released; are we truly prepared to make an enemy out of it?
ability: Normal attacks and Ice Novas inflict Arts damage and cause the Cold effect on affected targets; Ice Nova deals double damage to Frozen targets; FrostNova is temporarily invulnerable during her second form, and her attacks and skills are more powerful

name: Patriot
description: His armor is in disrepair and damaged in many places. The blade of his once sharp halberd is now eroded with rust. However, the indomitable Patriot never capitulates, never backs down, and never shows mercy. He has long struggled with fate, and now resolves to slit the throat of fate.
ability: Inspires his troops, greatly increasing their ATK and DEF; In Marching stance, he is extremely vulnerable to attacks; In Ruination stance, he uses long-ranged attacks, is immune to Stun effects, continuously deals True damage around him, and deals Physical damage to the farthest high ground unit.

name: Mudrock
description: Age unknown, gender unknown, history unknown. This ex-Reunion member now leads an organization of Infected and wanders the wilderness between the cities of Leithanien. What thoughts run through Mudrock's mind as being forced to once again step upon the battlefield?
ability: When attacking, permanently increases ATK, stacking up to 6 times; Has a barrier that absorbs spell damage; While the barrier persists, this unit has greatly increased Max HP and ASPD; Barrier periodically refreshes; Releases a skill that automatically seizes control of the nearest non-enemy controlled 'Gramophone.'

name: 'The Big Ugly Thing'
description: Zumama's magnum opus, a massive mechanical monster piloted by the High Priest. It can strike both in melee range and from a distance, capable of easily destroying Giant Mushrooms and Stumps. Normal engineers cannot even fathom how a machine slapped together haphazardly like this can even move, but move it indeed does.
ability: Periodically destroys Giant Mushrooms and Stumps, rendering them unable to be deployed upon; After this unit's HP drops to 0, it will explode, Stunning units in a large area and ejecting its pilot, the 'High Priest.'

name: Corrupted Knight
description: A Sarkaz knight with a broken horn who radiates terror and shows clear signs of excessive drug use. Uses a warhammer in battle. Crushes enemies with terrifying bloodlust. When the Withered Knight falls, takes up the quest and becomes dramatically stronger. Every step he takes spreads corruption.
ability: Deals physical damage to its target and four surrounding tiles when attacking. Growth attack deals high physical damage to its target and four surrounding tiles. When the Withered Knight dies, ATK, ASPD, and movement speed are significantly increased.

name: Withered Knight
description: A Sarkaz knight with a broken horn who radiates terror and shows clear signs of excessive drug use. Uses a cursed bow in battle. Can shoot multiple targets at once and plant seeds of withering arts. When the Corrupted Knight falls, takes up the quest and becomes dramatically stronger. Knights that are hostile to him will shift to Wither.
ability: Attacks two targets simultaneously. Fires explosive arrows at three targets, which explode after a short delay, dealing high Arts damage to the target and surrounding four tiles. When the Corrupted Knight dies, ATK, ASPD, and movement speed are significantly increased.

name: Mephisto, 'The Singer'
description: You seem to recognize the mysterious, mythical beast that has descended from the Sarcophagus. An otherworldly song flows from its sharp beak and floods its surroundings. It seems to devour the will of the Infected around it, including its own. Even if it knows not what it is doing, its song does not cease. It simply wishes to sing.
ability: When Activated, heals and strengthens an enemy Host unit; Each time a certain percentage of HP is lost, releases a toxic cloud across the entire battlefield that lasts for 30s and can stack. When HP drops to 0 for the first time, enters a dormant state for a period of time, then gains DEF, RES, and HP regeneration.

name: 'The Deathless Black Snake'
description: A disenchanted Reunion soldier, or a giant manipulating history? A conspirator full of lies, or a nobleman swallowed by tragedy? The truth has been turned to ash, and only an evil god stands in the flames.
ability: Attacks deal True damage and apply [Burning Breath] to the target (Deals increasing True damage each second, but can be resisted); Takes greatly reduced damage from targets afflicted by [Burning Breath]; Applies [Burning Breath] to two of your units; Detonates all units on the battlefield afflicted by [Burning Breath], dealing Arts damage to the surrounding four tiles and applying [Burning Breath] to targets hit by this splash effect. When HP drops to 0, releases [Deathless Inferno], dealing massive Arts damage across the battlefield; When Enraged, gains greatly increased HP and ATK and summons [Energy Aggregates] to assist in battle.

name: Jesselton Williams
description: Jesselton Williams, a killer who infiltrated the prison disguised as a jailer. Very particular in both speech and action, he remains graceful even in the midst of battle.
ability: In Jailer form, he has greatly increased RES, uses long-ranged Arts attacks, can Stun multiple targets, and does not attack Imprisonment Devices; In Killer form, he has greatly increased DEF, uses melee Physical attacks, and ignores a certain amount of the target's DEF; When changing to Killer form, immediately frees all other enemies

name: 'Free'
description: A monster drawn by Dusk. It has a commanding presence and chilling arrogance, as though taking a page out of its master's book. 'The virid beasts. Like range on range. Eleven told. In moon, smoke-flow.'
ability: 'Weft and Warp' deals Arts damage to enemies in the surrounding cross area, changing Hui-Ming attributes within its range; 'Break the Chains': If the shield is not yet broken, deal massive ranged damage; During second phase, attacks twice and additionally unleashes 'Weft and Warp' on farthest target.

name: 'Essence of Evolution'
description: A madman who should not have stepped upon this world. An oddity that should not have existed in the other world. The union of the two gave birth to this node of 'evolution' that far surpasses the limits of biology. It's existence naturally contradicts all of Terra. It should not live. It must not live.
ability: Unable to move; Will evolve after a certain duration or when HP falls below a certain threshold; Periodically creates <Originiutant Excrescence> or <Originiutant Tumor>; Periodically deals a large amount of True damage to all deployed Operators; During [Newborn Form], greatly reduce Physical and Arts damage taken from units to the left; During [Evolution Form], greatly reduce Physical and Arts damage taken from units to the right; During [Perfect Form], massively reduce Physical and Arts damage taken, however lose HP every second

name: 'Emperor's Blade', Pursuer
description: He once ravaged the demons of the Northern Tundra, segregating the outsiders beyond the reach of civilization; His blade shies not from royals nor nobles, safeguarding glory from the dusts of rebellion. Every Royal Guard is as a dominion; the land beneath their feet is all the territory of Ursus.
ability: Whenever a certain percentage of HP is lost, unleashes the permanent terrain effect [Dominion], significantly reducing allied units' ASPD and reducing Physical and Arts damage taken by self when within its effect (Prioritizes targeting the ally unit outside of [Dominion] with the highest damage dealt to self); Casts [Collapsing Fear] which deals Arts damage to nearby units, instantly defeating the target if they are within [Dominion]; The first time HP drops to 0, casts [Collapsing Fear] on the entire battlefield; During his second form, his attacks and skills are more powerful

name: Sal Viento Bishop Quintus
description: A member of the Church of the Deep who snuck into disaster-ravaged Iberia. He changed the law of the land through his sincere beliefs, in pursuit of the perfect form, yet he was unable to fathom the will of the ocean. Then again, who could?
ability: Attacks two targets with the highest DEF simultaneously; [Great Tide] deals Arts damage and Nervous Impairment to all allied units; [Collapse] deals Physical damage to multiple allied units; [Fragmentation] summons its offspring to entwine themselves around allied units and Stun them; [Species Outbreak] removes all Life Points when a long time has passed in the battle.

name: Pancho Salas
description: Pancho Salas, an old veteran piloting a heavily modified motorboat. Even should his vessel be destroyed, he will never falter before reaching his goal.
ability: Summons 'Kite' to fight alongside explosive boats; attacks the unit with the highest Max HP with its water cannon and continuously deals Arts and Corrosion Damage. During second phase, periodically attacks all surrounding units; attacks the unit with the highest DEF with its small arms and reduces the unit's DEF. When it defeats a unit or when it is defeated, increases the ATK and Movement Speed of all enemy units.

name: Mandragora
description: One of the leaders of the Dublinn forces, a caster who controls stone. Emerging from the darkness of Victoria, she has sworn to repay the humiliation she suffered at the hands of the nobles manyfold.
ability: [Stoneshield] Reduces damage taken, temporarily loses effect after being hit by a Tattered Pillar; [Mandragora's Gaze] Targets the unit with the highest ATK within range, dealing Arts damage and reducing their ASPD. If the target is retreated or defeated, destroy the tile the unit was on; In her second form, [Stoneshield] also grants Low-Altitude Hovering, and Mandragora becomes able to knock down Tattered Pillars

name: The Blood Knight Dikaiopolis
description: The Blood Knight, Dikaiopolis. The originator of Kazimierz's Infected Knight program, the hero of the Grand Knight Territory's Infected, and an idol to countless children. What exactly did the 'hero' give up to obtain the peace we know today?
ability: Reduce damage taken, however this effect is ineffective against the unit blocking self; 'Exsanguination': Stun the target and deal Arts damage every second; After the HP of his first form drops to 0, enters 'Resurrection Stance'. During this period, the Blood Knight is invulnerable and continuously summons Bloodblades, and enters the second form after some time. If the Blood Knight's HP is restored to its maximum while in 'Resurrection Stance', he will return to his first form; During his second form, he has increased ATK, uses ranged attacks, and continuously summons Bloodblades.

name: Degenbrecher
description: Three-time champion of the Kazimierz Major, a defective Leithanian unable to use Arts, a natural-born warrior—The Black Knight.
ability: Immune to Frozen and gains status resistance; ATK increases during snowfall and, when blocked, attacks against the blocker ignore a certain amount of DEF; [Swift Slayer] When blocked, bypasses the target and deals Physical damage to units along the path; [Brutalizing Blizzard] Deals Physical damage to units in the surrounding area; During her second form, gain Invisibility, attacks ignore more DEF and deal damage twice, [Momentum Murder] Whenever 25% HP is lost, clears the SP of all allied units in range and prevent the targets from attacking or healing for some time.

name: 'Sui-Xiang'
description: The shadow of the bestial Sui, towering and venerable. It casts its lazy gaze upon the mortal realm, and in the blink of an eye a thousand years have come and gone. With the millennium passing like a dream, it is uncertain whether it is feeling anger or bitterness.
ability: Reduces damage taken from above and below; When defeated during its Stage 1 or 2 form, after a period of time, the unit takes its next form and reappears a certain distance to the right; [Faraway Mountains' Thunderclap] Deals continuous Arts damage to units within cross areas around three ranged units; [Heavensfall] Deals Physical damage twice to melee units and additionally inflicts continuous Arts damage that slowly increases over time (can be resisted); [Omnidirectional Breath] Inflicts continuous damage to a large area to the right and renders the tiles no longer available for deployment; Operators in the left side of the target area can reduce damage taken by allied units to the right and mitigate damage to the tiles.

name: Andoain, the 'Martyr'
description: A Sankta who made an enemy of Laterano for the sake of asking a question. A Pathfinder who tread the path of peril for the sake of receiving an answer. He feels neither wrath nor sorrow. He neither curses God, nor beseeches man. Andoain only follows his own path, wherever it may end.
ability: Cannot be blocked. While holding Ammo, this unit gains increased ATK, and attacks will cause Ammo to bounce to a nearby target, up to a maximum of 5 bounces, dealing additional damage to 'Gelato Stops'. Ammo capacity: 5; After losing a certain percentage of HP, creates a permanent field effect, 'Light Unto Sufferers'. Enemies standing on 'Light Unto Sufferers' take reduced Physical and Arts Damage and gain 50% Physical and Arts Dodge. After being defeated once, enters his Second Form, gaining increased ATK and periodically using 'Ashes to Ashes, Dust to Dust': Andoain stops attacking and scans the battlefield from left to right, locking onto at most 5 targets before dealing massive Physical Damage to them and fully replenishing his Ammo.

name: Manfred
description: A young Sarkaz general, member of the Military Commission of Kazdel. After enlisting a large number of mercenaries in Londinium, he has assembled and trained a brand new type of fighting force. His Arts Unit 'Teekazwurtzen' was bestowed upon him by Theresis, the Regent of Kazdel, who also taught him the swordsmanship he now employs.
ability: Uses his floating cannon to inflict Arts damage; Upon firing, floating cannon will charge up Londinium Secondary Defense Artillery. [Focus] Continuously gains ASPD when attacking the same target (this effect is capped), rapidly decaying when switching targets or not attacking for a few seconds; [Military Training] Has high Physical and Arts dodge, but after being bombarded by the City Defense Artillery, temporarily loses this dodge effect and is stunned for a few seconds; [From Withered Trunk, New Branches] When defeated for the first time, randomly attacks all targets on the battlefield with his floating cannon, greatly accelerating the charge rate of Londinium Secondary Defense Artillery; In his second form, draws his sword alongside his floating cannon to perform simultaneous Physical and Arts attacks.

name: The Endspeaker, Will of We Many
description: The tiny Seaborn that haunted the mighty Stultifera, the blood of its parents once strewn across the ocean's waters. The revelation reaches not the ears of the children, their kind's destiny quietly continuing to flow.
ability: When defeated, disappears for a short time before evolving into its next form, gaining the following effects in turn: Gains increased DEF/Gains increased Movement Speed/Gains increased ATK and Lifesteal; [Consume] Consumes the Remains of its Seaborn kin, gaining their corresponding Directed Evolution ability in the next evolutionary phase, while also instantly defeating any Operators near the Remains and preventing them from being redeployed for a period of time.

name: Kreide, 'Worldly Remains'
description: Kreide's form, covered in layers of Originium, calls forth only fear in Leithanien. He stopped the Voice of Mundane from consuming others, yet he himself was consumed in turn. He tried to save everyone present, yet there remains only one way to save him.
ability: Attacks deal splash damage. When blocked, attacks inflict Stun; [The Final Rest] Starts with increased DEF and RES; After being defeated the first time, temporarily changes to an allied unit, then loses the increased DEF and RES, and increases ATK and skill power instead; [Resonance Overload] Causes Realigned Flux to deal continuous damage; [Lamentation of Nothingness] Attacks all targets on the field in order and loses a large amount of HP. When in Realigned Flux, ASPD is reduced

name: 'Awaken'
description: The 'Dreamland' that Dorothy personally created. In here, no one will ever have to suffer the pain of the journey. Love and hope shall achieve that which technology cannot.
ability: Cannot move; Periodically transfers itself to a specified tile and casts [Shattered Vision], dealing a large amount of damage to all units on the field. This damage is split equally among all deployed units; Periodically casts [Journey] towards the left and right, dealing Physical damage to the first unit hit; When 'Awaken' receives damage, transfers 50% of the damage received to Dorothy's other experiments on the field; In its second form, it increases ATK and immediately activates all R-Series Power Armors on the field. [Shattered Vision] will also Stun units on high ground and [Journey] will be cast in all 4 directions.

name: 'Materialist Antagonizer'
description: Construction machinery attempting to protect Stitch Canvas, under the mistaken impression that he is about to be attacked. Before explaining what's actually going on, let's settle things with a test of strength first.
ability: While on the battlefield, increases the strength of all [Machina] enemies; attacks will deploy small drones that deal continuous Arts damage to the target for a period of time, prioritizing targets that are not already locked onto by these drones; periodically refreshes a shield that can resist Physical and Arts damage, and grants Invisibility to other enemies within attack range as long as this shield holds; periodically locks on to the friendly unit with the greatest number of units around it and continuously deals Arts damage in an area around that unit; periodically locks on to the friendly unit with the fewest number of units around it and continuously inflicts Stun in an area around that unit; when HP drops to 0, Stitch will appear and be Stunned for a period of time

name: 'The Last Steam Knight'
description: Steam Knights are the pride of Victoria, her fist, her highest military honor. The last Steam Knight rises from sealed ruins, intent on defending the Victoria in his heart.
ability: ATK and Movement Speed are reduced at the start, and restored once [Pneumatic Pressurization] is triggered. [Pneumatic Pressurization]: ATK and Movement Speed increased, becomes immune to control, becomes stunned when expired. [Furious Defense] Charges up before attacking, dealing heavy damage 3 times. [Unto My Last Breath] Leaps into the air after losing a certain amount of HP, targeting your unit with the highest max HP, dealing Arts damage multiple times to the nearby unit with the highest HP percentage. In 2nd form, DEF and RES are reduced, [Pneumatic Pressurization] is permanently active, and [Unto My Last Breath] locks onto an additional target.

name: Zaaro, Signore dei Lupi

ability: Gradually increases 'Blood Debt' over time; Damage Reduction; [Hemolytic Horror] Causes 3 friendly units to be consumed by fear, greatly reducing their ASPD, significantly accelerating their periodic HP loss, and causing them to be unable to be retreated manually; Affected units will return to normal after 'Signore dei Lupi' takes a certain percentage of damage; After the first form reaches 0 HP, gains [Primal Deterrence], causing nearby friendly units to have reduced ASPD, and slowly gains HP over time. In the second form, no longer has Damage Reduction, can now be stunned, and no longer casts [Hemolytic Horror]. Attacks instead turn into a long-ranged double strike with increased ATK. Periodically releases a [Furious Howl], causing 'Blood Debt' to increase rapidly

name: 'The Leader'

In second form, ATK increases, all Reeds on the field instantly ignite, melee attacks deal damage proportional to own double ATK, and ranged attacks and [Sovereign] can choose an additional target

name: 'Ya'
description: The executor of the Feranmut, 'Ya.' According to the Sui Regulators' ancient scrolls, one of the Feranmuts hunted by the Yan a thousand years ago, with the mystical ability to 'cut away the seasons and hold them at Its bosom.' Its wounds still refuse to close, and It laps at them in fury and bewilderment... It returns once more to familiar Yan soil.
ability: Applies 'Winter's Void' on tiles It travels over, [Winter's Void] Continuously summons enemies; [Spring's Birth] Summons a Mirage when blocked. Mirage gains Low-Altitude Hovering and applies [Winter's Void] on tiles it travels over. If not defeated after some time, 'Ya' teleports to its location. When Its HP reaches 0 in its first form, attains [Autumn's Bounty], [Slice the Seasons], [Worldly Self], attacks change to ranged with increased Attack Range, and gains Low-Altitude Hovering. [Autumn's Bounty] Summons a Delusion that has similar abilities to 'Ya' and also applies 'Winter's Void' on tiles it travels over. When 'Ya' is defeated, the Delusion also dies; if the Delusion dies, 'Ya' loses a percentage of Its max HP; [Slice the Seasons] 'Ya' and Delusion deal AoE damage, then switch places and routes; [Worldly Self] 'Ya' and Delusion deal AoE damage to surrounding units.

name: Rathalos
description: The crimson-carapaced, flame-commanding Rathalos, its capacity for flight excels among Flying Wyverns, its aerial assaults and flaming breath combine to dominate over a vast array of life. Owing to the astonishing strength by which it rules the air, it is also known as the 'King of the Skies.'
ability: The Rathalos's tail can be severed by attacking it from behind in its Grounded State; Flash Grenades can knock the Rathalos out of its Flying State; if it is not defeated in the first wave, it will [Nest] and move into the stage's [Den] wave

name: 'Hateful Avenger'
description: A Reunion squad leader you've previously faced, who attacks with an impressive searing blade. The formidable foe you defeated in the Area 59 Ruins appears before you once again, unsheathing the flames of vengeance.

name: Eblana
description: Leader of Dublinn, the Draco who burns through all facades.

name: 'Damazti Cluster'
description: The long-lived that wanders outside the Sarkaz Royal Court, facing the path of flame.

name: 'Damazti Cluster'
description: A long-lived that has drifted away from the Sarkaz Royal Court. They have taken the rise and fall of the various races as a sort of life experience, but the Damazti Cluster has yet to find the answer to what 'living' means.
ability: Spy. Whenever a certain percentage of HP is lost, summons an Isomorphic Fragment on an Operator or on the field that shares HP with the 'Damazti Cluster'; Every Isomorphic Fragment summoned reduces Physical and Arts Damage received by both the Damazti Cluster and Isomorphic Fragment; Both the Damazti Cluster and Isomorphic Fragments are Invulnerable while their identities have yet to be revealed; Attacks inflict Corrosion Damage; Periodically releases [Derivative Iteration]: both the Damazti Cluster and Isomorphic Fragments simultaneously deal Physical damage to a unit; The Damazti Cluster regenerates itself when defeated for the first time, and while regenerating, deals continuous Arts Damage to all units near the Damazti Cluster or Isomorphic Fragments; In second form, periodically releases [Lifeline Burst] which locks onto all allies on the field, and after a period of time deals Arts Damage to the targets and any allies in the adjacent 4 tiles and summons a Deconstructed Distortion on the locked-on positions. When the second form's HP is lower than a certain percentage for the first time, summons an Isomorphic Fragment on an Operator, and this Operator can not be deployed again. Prioritizes Operators without allies nearby

name: Kristen
description:
Egotist. Betrayer. Seeker. Loner. Pioneer.
Goodnight, Terra.
ability: First form: Immune to control effects and takes reduced damage from 'Planetary Debris'; Periodically overrides 'Planetary Debris' and turns them into 'Star Rings' (Allies in the surrounding 8 tiles take Arts Damage and have reduced ASPD); Every 'Star Ring' grants Kristen +1 Block Count and reduces damage received; [Heat Death] When HP reaches 0 for the first time, detonates every 'Star Ring' on the field, dealing Arts Damage to all friendly units. Immediately overrides all 'Planetary Debris' when entering her second form; When Kristen is in her second form, attacks 1 additional target, and no longer overrides 'Planetary Debris', but destroying a 'Star Ring' deals Arts Damage to all allies on the field and increases all enemies' Movement Speed; detonates all 'Star Rings' on the field when HP reaches 0 in second form

name: Lost Colossus

name: Jetman

The most valuable thing he's stolen is a single burdenbeast. However, the fact that he made his own jetpack might mean that he really is a master.

name: 'Forsaken One'
description: 'The rescuers found a security guard who had been heavily corroded by Originium... already turned into a terrifying monster... carnage everywhere... countless casualties... whereabouts unknown.' —Rim Billiton mining record
ability: Drains 5 Life Points when entering the Objective Point; Continuous attacks will increase ATK and ASPD, up to a limit. This effect will reset after a few seconds after this unit stops attacking.

name: Rusthammer Warrior

ability: Drains 30 Life Points when entering the Objective Point; Cannot be blocked, and is Invulnerable for a period of time after entering the battle; Periodically releases a special bolt that deals massive Arts damage.

name: 'Frozen Monstrosity'

name: 'Snow Doe'

name: Big Sad Lock

name: 'Troupe Mouthpiece'

name: 'Paranoia Illusion'

Relying on his cunning and life experiences over the years, he became a boxing fixer in the wilderness, and even had the beautiful dream of snatching some land in a nomadic city to build a underground boxing arena, but he had no idea that the key to success or failure was never in his hands to begin with.
ability: Takes less damage from all units other than the blocker when blocked, gets knocked down to rest when health drops to a certain percentage; when all HP is restored, gets up again and ASPD increases.

Some scholars believe that its ability to fly is new evidence of unintelligent organisms actively manipulating complex Originium Arts, while others believe it is nothing more than a naturally occurring phenomenon under hyper-specific conditions. This question has yet to be resolved, as no biologist has been desperate enough to approach it.

She's now brandishing an arsenal of weapons built by her construction crew, and recklessly destroying her Mama's new plate.

name: Tribal Shaman

name: Lord Ameer Shaman

name: Vein Guardian

name: 'Consortium of Pincers'

When on the move, it's almost as if golden sand was falling from its body, so it is highly sought by collectors and artists. However, it is extremely nimble and difficult to capture, but is the secret ingredient spoken of in legends... do you really want to hunt it?
ability: Does not attack; after being attacked, runs away a random distance and rests for a period of time. Moves through different areas

name: 'The Immortal'

A ferocious carnivore, but this one seems to have had its meal, and is merely curious about the tiny things that have appeared before it.

name: Dauntless Linebreaker

After some time, they return to the mech and it returns to its first form.
